channel.title: Comments on: R.I.P. The Cramps’ Lux Interior October 21, 1946 â€“ February 4, 2009

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description:
@eric re: MOZ -Amusing and makes complete sense.
I don't dislike them, but I was never a huge fan. I recognize their influence on modern music and all that, of course. I kinda feel the same way about a lot of those influential '70s bands. Ramones, Sex Pistols, New York Dolls, et al.
item.content:encoded:
@eric re: MOZ -Amusing and makes complete sense.

I don’t dislike them, but I was never a huge fan. I recognize their influence on modern music and all that, of course. I kinda feel the same way about a lot of those influential ’70s bands. Ramones, Sex Pistols, New York Dolls, et al.

item.title: By: AJW
item.dc:creator: AJW
item.description:
Lux's performance from Urgh! A Music War is unforgettable. That outfit, the microphone fellatio...
(What is up with that new embedded YouTube video label? That's really unattractive.)
item.content:encoded:
Lux’s performance from Urgh! A Music War is unforgettable. That outfit, the microphone fellatio…

(What is up with that new embedded YouTube video label? That’s really unattractive.)

item.title: By: Eric Greenwood

item.description: morrissey was president of their fan club in his teens.
item.content:encoded: morrissey was president of their fan club in his teens.

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description: I must admit I've always been rather perplexed by the popularity of The Cramps, particularly the people that were quite drawn to them.
item.content:encoded: I must admit I’ve always been rather perplexed by the popularity of The Cramps, particularly the people that were quite drawn to them.
